page.title: 15Mr. C.W. CRAMP continued...
page.content: Horsham has grown very much since the 1920's when Mr. Cramp was a boy. The population having grown nearly to 26000. The family jewellery business was started by his grandfather in 1872. It was originaly near the Town Hall, then it moved to Middle St. and then to West St. in 1878. Then, only about three jewellers were in Horsham. Nowadays there is fierce competition with 7 other businesses. His favourite parts of Horsham are the Causeway and Denne Hill. He also likes the hustle and bustle of Horsham Station. He believes that Horsham has developed over the years and this can only bring prosperity to the town. If office blocks merge into the surroundings then the character of Horsham will not change drastically.
